column4: Anyone wanna help me fix Thunderbird?  I've looked around for a solution to the "Thunderbird already running" problem, to no avail.  I have 11.10 in 64 bit
Do ps -A to find out it's pid, then kill it with -9 and retry opening it
The problem is that, when I look in System Monitor, there is no presence of either thunderbird nor thunderbird-bin
run ps -A | grep thunderbird
I just did ... and it came back with nothing
So it tells me that it is running when I try to start it, but it is nowhere
I'm gonna walk the dog, but I hope you'll be able to find a solution when I get back.  I would appreciate it, in any case
Any ideas during my absence?
Thunderbird telling me that it is already running  when I try to start it
oh I remember now. Is it all the time, i.e. does it happen the first time you open it after booting?
It started happening during the last days of 11.04 and continues to happen with 11.10
Hmm, in that case it could be due to a recent update to Thunderbird. If your reboot and try to open it, does it run fine?
I profited from the fact that, on the EEEPC, I didn't have the problem.  Today the EEEPC went for repairs
No
Someone suggested that I do something to a mozilla file or directory

I really don't know how to help you, unless the problem is another user (root) having some issue with starting Thunderbird on boot or something, which it shouldn't. You could try uninstalling thunderbird and removing your settings for it then reinstalling and reconfiguring it.
Does that mean deleting ~/.mozilla or ~/.thunderbird?
depends where its settings are stored. Firefox settings are also stored in ~/.mozilla so you may want to be careful with what you delete.
But deleting ~/.thunderbird is safe?
Back it up first just in case you need to get some stored emails or something like that out of it later
But that won't hurt Firefox or something else?  All I risk to lose is mails that are on the system?
Thanks.  Also arghx
No. Firefox settings are storied in ~/.mozilla. You will lose your mail if you delete it without backing up and you've deleted the mail from your mail server.
